Very Good and Nice App for monitoring Sugar BP and Medicine. Recommend for those to Monitor and keep healthy

MyTherapy is the best free medication management app I've found. It's really easy to use and has been invaluable whilst I have been put on an extensive regime of pills and other meds. I have been using it with a 4 section dosette box to make sure I take everything I should. I can use the app to make sure the pills are set up ready. There's even a section in the app for adding in the occasional medications, like for breakthrough pain management in my case.
It has its issues but has improved and will hopefully get better with all the feedback.
Klasse App. Super finde ich den Wechselwirkungscheck.

A Free Pain Medication Tracker that I wouldn't be without. I have to take different meds at different times of the day and I'm not sure how I'd manage to remember without this App. Not only that, it lets me know when I'm getting low and need to order more.
Great App easy to set up and still use a very good App it helps me keep track of my medication.highly recommended thank you

Life-Saver and Game-Changer! This app has completely transformed how I manage my medication routine. I used to constantly worry about missing doses, injecting on the wrong side, or running out of meds but not anymore! What I love most is how intuitive and reliable it is. The reminders are perfectly timed, and the app even tells me which side to inject on, so I never have to second-guess. It takes all the mental load off my shoulders, especially during busy or stressful days.

I cannot recommend this app enough! It's the only reason I remember to take all my meds and get prescriptions refilled on time. It's also great for keeping track of contact info for my whole healthcare team. They're adding great new features all the time. I love that I can track meds for my pets now too. Don't love the AI assistant but it's pretty easy to avoid. Overall great app!

Don't have a way to file bugs or feedback in the app. If you mark a medication later than your alarm, your next reminder doesn't take that into account. I.E. If you forgot to take a morning medication and only remember an hour before the next time. The app will still remind you for the next medication an hour later. This leads to some scary implications for people potentially overdosing.

After testing various applications, this one has consistently performed flawlessly, even during multiple data transfers to new devices.
